options.text: In asexual reproduction, the offsprings produced are morphologically and genetically identical  to the parent.
In asexual reproduction, a single parent produces offsprings.
Conidia are asexual structures in Penicillium.

solution.text: Asexual reproduction is the method of reproduction where a single parent is capable of giving birth to an offspring. The offspring thus born is not only morphologically but also genetically identical to the parent. In certain plants like algae and in kingdom fungi there are special structures present to carry out asexual reproduction. Most common of these are the zoospores which are microscopic motile structures. Other examples include conidia in Penicillium, buds in Hydra, gemmules in Sponge, etc
